sub_title: Gender and GBV Research, Programme Development and M&E Expert; MBA, PhD
summary:
I am a consultant for UN Women (having worked with over 12 country offices in Asia Pacific and Europe), and other UN and international organisations. I also manage a development consulting firm based in the Netherlands. I hold an MBA in International Organisations from the University of Geneva, and a PhD in Political Science for which I researched aid effectiveness, decolonising aid & engaging grassroots organisations in the Global South, at the West University of Timisoara (where I also taught courses in political science, ex: feminism & post-colonialism for International Development Master's students).

Currently, I mainstream gender into United Nations country development frameworks and other sectoral plans in several countries. I also develop evidence-based programme design and strategies to end violence against women for UN Women country offices in Asia Pacific and Europe.

With over 20 years of experience managing gender and human rights programmes, I've worked in Geneva, Asia and the Pacific, Europe, the Caribbean & South America on developing strategies for change—policy and behaviour change—to fulfil the rights of women and marginalised groups. I advise on, and conduct, evidence-based programme design, gender analysis & mainstreaming, research, training, M&E, and rights-based advocacy on issues, such as: gender-based violence prevention, SRHR, youth, inclusion and disability, humanitarian action and crisis response. 

I also have programme implementation expertise in the Global South with extensive experience in CSO and grassroots community mobilisation and training, local governance and participation, policy advocacy and social norm change.

Expertise:
PROGRAMME DESIGN AND STRATEGY
-developing  and adapting evidence-based programme strategies  
-research on what works, and designing scoping studies
-gender analysis and mainstreaming in SDGs 

POLICY AND ADVOCACY
-policy analysis & local governance 
- integrating gender into municipal governance and various national policy areas (such as in health, justice, digital agenda, labour, agriculture, corruption, youth policy, etc.)
-social and gender norm change and behaviour change strategies 
-rights-based advocacy strategy & building CSO movements 
 
ORGANISATION EFFECTIVENESS & RESULTS
-management consulting, organisation development (OD), capacity assessment & change management
-M&E (including designing results & evaluation framework, tools, staff training) 
-training programme development  
-scaling impact, media engagement, manual development, fundraising & proposal writing

profile_positions.location: Afghanistan, Albania, Thailand, Myanmar, Vietnam, Bangladesh, Indonesia, Papua New Guinea
profile_positions.description:
UN Women Afghanistan (Mar - Present 2023)
-Developing EVAW Programme Design and Prevention Strategy
-Designing partner engagement strategy for CSOs
-Providing technical advice on partner support, GBV service delivery and social norm change

UN Women Myanmar (Oct'22 - Present)
-Currently supporting gender analysis and gender and GBV mainstreaming for UN Transitional Cooperation Framework (including in ToC, Results Framework, budget, implementation)
-Training UN agencies on gender analysis and mainstreaming
-Supported M&E across the humanitarian-peace-development nexus

UN Women Albania (Jul'21-Apr'22)
-Wrote gender mainstreaming guidance for 8 sectors (justice, digital, youth, DRR, public reform, etc.) for  government to adopt EU acquis and strengthen gender-responsive governance aligned with EU pre-accession assistance & UN Joint Programme “EU for Gender Equality in Albania”.

UN Women Bangladesh (2019-Present)
-Project evaluation of GBV-WEE for shelter programming as COVID-19 response
-Developed 4-yr programme on GBV prevention; and reprogramming strategy for COVID-19 crisis/GBV response
-Designed and conducted research on what works in VAW prevention, engaging over 100 stakeholders in-country
-Advised on strategy implementation; training staff and partners on gender & local governance and M&E 
-Developed methodology for GBV essential services assessment based on UN ESP

UN Women Regional Office, Bangkok (2016-2021)
-10-country Mid-Term Review of ASEAN Regional Plan of Action for EVAW, with  national consultations and evaluations (e.g., Brunei, Myanmar, Thailand)
-Safe Cities regional concept notes and policy research to support country offices 
-Managed Safe Cities Programme in the Philippines, mobilising national movement and behaviour change, etc.
-Technical support to Asia Pacific countries on strategy and research, drafted training toolkits on youth & GBV,  technical inputs on baseline research for Vietnam, advocacy materials for Papua New Guinea, etc.
profile_positions.title: Gender and GBV Programme Development and M&E Expert

profile_positions.description:
UN Women Fiji Multi-County Office for the Pacific (Jun 2020-May 2021)
-Wrote two 10-day curricula with standardised TOT manuals on GBV counselling, GBV prevention in schools/sports, gender, rights for Fiji, Solomon, Kiribati, Vanuatu, Tonga—including facilitator guide, participant handbook, PPTs and assessment; in consultation with crisis centres and technical specialists in GBV counselling in the Pacific 

UN Women Timor-Leste (2017-2020)
-Conducted Scoping Study on SH and GBV in public spaces; 
-Drafted programme strategies/policy recommendations for Safe Cities Dili, developed project design, results framework & training modules for implementing partners
-Developed Joint Programme with 6 UN agencies and technical advise on behaviour-change, advocacy & partner capacity building 
 
UN Women Georgia (September 2019)
-Developed sexual harassment / GBV prevention Communication Toolkit on behaviour change for government interagency commission on gender and violence against women
-Trained communication specialists from government ministries on behaviour change strategy and message development

UN Women Geneva (2018)
-Developed M&E framework for the Humanitarian Action & Crisis Response Office
-Analysed country reports on women's leadership, empowerment and protection in crisis response

UN Women Philippines (2016-2017)
-Expanded Safe Cities Metro Manila to Manila City and led advocacy and community mobilisation for the passing of city laws to increase investment in making communities safer and more secure
-Developed training modules and conducted TOT for government and NGOs on integrating Safe Cities and gender analysis in local governance and advocacy, as well as in gender mainstreaming in SDG development plans
profile_positions.title: International Consultant - GBV /Safe Cities Strategy Development, Research and Training

profile_positions.description:
1. Designed and led UN Women's Global Safe Cities Programme in the Philippines: implemented strategies for locally-owned, policy-oriented advocacy to end sexual harassment and violence against women in public spaces, design & implementation of behavior change communication, and a successful public education campaign reaching over 2.5M people
2. Led advocacy for successful passing of 2 city laws and a national law imposing sanctions on sexual harassment and violence against women in public spaces through partnerships, negotiation and policy research & development, with special attention to at-risk groups e.g, LGBT, women with disabilities
3. Developed partnerships with Mayors' offices and city governments, NGOs, and grassroots organizations and led innovative collaborations (e.g., with computer programmers to design mobile apps for women's safety, with LGBT and HIV-prevention advocates, national celebrities and media outlets to promote the issue on mainstream media, with theater companies to train youth on theater for advocacy)
4. Managed donor relations and successfully accessed new funds by developing project strategies and writing proposals to donors
5. Worked with the Safe Cities Global Technical Team (SC GTT) in HQ in New York, Asia-Pacific Regional Office & other UN agencies to enhance global communication, implement strategies and manage donor relations
6. Facilitated links with national networks to integrate women's safety issues in humanitarian action and DRR, developing M&E framework for gender in humanitarian action (GiHA) in the country
7. Designed and facilitated training for government and community leaders and youth on gender, VAW, & rights-based advocacy skills, and supported locally-initiated advocacy to end sexual harassment of women in public spaces including through integrating it into comprehensive sexuality education.
8. Developed research tools and design for scoping study, and oversaw baseline data research with national demographers
profile_positions.title: Safe Cities Country Programme Manager

profile_positions.description:
The Connective Paths Foundation (CPF) is a resource and grant facility established in 2021 to facilitate the use of development funds for community-led change in the Global South. 

The CPF does not just fund programs or projects. It funds organisations in the global south in order to truly co-create solutions and address the most important priorities identified by and with the CSOs and communities. 

CPF provides an alternative to practices that lead to short-term, donor-driven and project-based funding. It also promotes trust-based collaborations, centers local expertise, and supports grassroots innovation for development planning and good governance.

Lastly, it provides advisory services to CSOs and donors in the global north on how to go beyond the rhetoric of decolonising aid and put concrete changes into action.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder and Executive Director

profile_positions.description: Together with Results in Health, currently conducting multi-country mid-term evaluation of the Generation Gender Partnership (Gen G) across 7 countries: Jordan, Lebanon, Morocco, Rwanda, South Africa, Uganda and Indonesia.
profile_positions.title: Gender and Evaluation Expert

profile_positions.description:
KCMB is a development consulting firm (https://www.kcmbconsulting.com/) with expertise in achieving and measuring gender and  development results.  We do this through K.C.M.B.: Knowledge generation, Capacity building, Measuring effectiveness and Behaviour-change advocacy. We work with a network of over 50 Technical Experts and Associates with over 20 years of experience—across as many countries in Asia, Middle East, Africa, Europe, Latin America and the Pacific. 

We aim to see *change in action*. This means both operationalising strategies, and changing business-as-usual approaches to improve effectiveness of gender-responsive development projects. We support NGOs, UN and other international organisations through inclusive, gender transformative and people-centred methods, that improve local communities' self-reliance, access to social justice, participatory decision-making, and resilience.

•	Developed company start-up concept and strategy
•	Formed the growing network of international development consultants with experience in humanitarian and development research, training, programming, implementation and evaluation in over 20 countries, across 15 language skills, and in sectors such as gender & GBV, WASH, food & nutrition, disability, livelihoods, education, volunteering, migration & IDPs, camp management, peace & security, DRR and rule of law.
•	Directing external programme and strategy and internal engagement—both espousing our Company Values of Integrity, Humility, Collaboration and Compassion and Core Competencies of: Professionalism, Rights-based and Diversity, Creative Problem-Solving,  Effective Communication and Listening, and Growth Mentality
profile_positions.title: Managing Director

profile_positions.description:
Member of the Technical Review Group (TRG) as a gender expert with thematic expertise in the field of ending violence against women and girls with disabilities, to help facilitate the Fund’s independent, transparent, and competitive review of applications annually (since 2017-present)

The UN Trust Fund is a leading global multilateral mechanism supporting national efforts to end one of the most widespread human rights violations in the world. It focuses on supporting country and local implementation of laws, policies and action plans to address violence against women, while maintaining flexibility in terms of responsiveness to a wide-range of forms of violence, national and emerging priorities and needs, and diverse approaches. It awards multiyear grants of between US$ 50,000 and US$ 1 million to civil society and government applicants.
profile_positions.title: Gender Expert and Reviewer for UN Trust Fund to End Violence Against Women

profile_positions.description: Conducting research on Gender and Governance in Myanmar for the UNDP Global Programme on the Role of Parliaments as Partners in Women, Peace, and Security, which will also produce  recommendations and entry points for WPS and increasing women's political participation.
profile_positions.title: Gender and Governance Expert

profile_positions.description:
-Developed the "SHIFT Social and Gender Norms Tool Package" to measure changes in social gender norms to end child marriage across the humanitarian-development nexus.
-As lead Gender Expert in collaboration with Results in Health, I conducted a regional research on transforming social and gender norms perpetuating CEFM in Asia Pacific. The work involved gathering data across 10 countries  (6 countries with primary data gathering), and produced recommendations on social and gender norm change strategies for the regional and country offices.
profile_positions.title: Gender Transformative Approach Expert

company.name: Harvard Humanitarian Initiative, Equality Insights and SVRI

profile_positions.description: -Collaborating with SVRI and researchers from Harvard Humanitarian Initiative, Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health and JPAL, developed the IPV-ADAPT+ Framework to aid in the adaptation of evidence-based interventions preventing IPV in various contexts (humanitarian, online, culturally diverse settings, etc.)
profile_positions.title: International Consultant on GBV Prevention

profile_positions.description:
-Conduct Gender and Diversity Analysis of UNFPA's areas of work on FP/SRH access and rights, particularly identifying the issues of the underserved and most marginalised groups of women and men in four provinces in Pakistan
-Design a new Gender and Diversity Analysis Tool based on global gender assessment methodology and practices (e.g., Harvard Analytical Framework, Moser Framework, People-Oriented Planning Framework, UNFPA Culture Lens Framework, etc.), and adapted for the country and program context (including humanitarian and development nexus programming) 
-Conduct primary and secondary data gathering and research with local partners
-Design and conduct a Gender Impact  Assessment to forecast gender outcomes from the SMK Project, based on global tools such as Canada's GBA+, EIGE's GIA Mainstreaming Tool, etc.
profile_positions.title: Gender and Diversity Analysis Expert

profile_positions.description: --Designed and conducted a gender assessment of ACF Myanmar's programming in the Northern and Central Rakhine Sate, including in the IDP camps. The assessment identified gender issues and entry points for gender mainstreaming in nutrition, mental health and care practices, protection, food security, livelihoods and WASH. Analysis was also conducted on specific gender issues faced by Rohingya and Rakhine women, men and youth.
profile_positions.title: Gender Analysis Expert

volunteer_experiences.description: Geneva-based foundation also known for the 'Womanity Award', a pioneering development strategy that offers support and mentoring to a winning innovative project with great potential and capacity to scale up. Womanity Foundation aims to empower girls and women to shape their future and accelerate progress within their communities. We do this through innovation, collaboration, scaling-up, and replication.
Supporting  VSO Lead Global Gender Advisor and training/mentoring VSO staff members and volunteers  from 24 countries on gender, GBV and social norm change.

volunteer_experiences.description: Geneva-based NGO working to eradicate modern slavery by enabling and motivating business to clean slavery from their supply chains.

Participation and sharing of information is key to our philosophy. We write about human rights issues, migration, gender, environmental issues, political affairs, current affairs and international relations. We have contributors from India, Kenya, Italy, UK, Somalia, Colombia, Philippines, Spain, and Ireland.
